keyMoments.title: Luffy Remembers His Crew
keyMoments.description: Luffy pictures all of his crew members and hears their voices calling to him, reminding him why he needs to keep going.
keyMoments.significance: The Straw Hat crew, though separated and not physically present, becomes the catalyst for Luffy's emotional recovery. Their bonds transcend physical distance.

description: Luffy's pirate crew, currently separated across the world after Kuma sent them away during the Sabaody Archipelago incident. Though scattered, the bonds between crew members remain strong.
jollyRoger: A skull wearing a straw hat

keyMoments.title: Red Hair Pirates at the Burial
keyMoments.description: The Red Hair Pirates help the Whitebeard Pirates conduct funeral ceremonies for Ace and Whitebeard in the New World.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the respect and honor between pirate crews, and Shanks' connection to both Whitebeard and Luffy's story.

description: One of the Four Emperors' crews, led by Shanks. Known for their strength and influence in the New World.

keyMoments.title: Whitebeard Pirates Bury Their Captain and Ace
keyMoments.description: The remaining Whitebeard Pirates, led by Marco, conduct funeral ceremonies for their fallen captain Edward Newgate and their brother Portgas D. Ace.
keyMoments.significance: Marks the end of the Whitebeard era and the crew's transition to a new chapter without their legendary captain.

description: Formerly one of the Four Emperors' crews, the Whitebeard Pirates suffered devastating losses at the Battle of Marineford, including their captain Whitebeard and 2nd Division Commander Ace. The crew is now led by Marco and faces an uncertain future.
